phrases.phrase: Don't modify the display of my collapsed categories!
If you select this option, the display of your categories once collapsed will remain the same, which means the ToggleME Style Properties Options for categories will have no effect.

You can select here to automatically close some Extra Categories, for example the Shoutbox. To perform this operation, you have to find their IDs. The easiest way to do it is to look inside your page html code and find the tag of their Toggle Button.

The IDs of these EXTRA categories always use the same following pattern: _crc_XX-X (X being some numbers)

If you want to add several Extra Categories IDs, you HAVE to separate each ID with a coma. Example: _crc_36-1,_crc_36-2
Choose which easing effect to use during toggle actions. Here's a website which might help you to choose . Default value: easeOutQuad.
Use this to disable toggleME when necessary.
ToggleME can activate 'expand/collapse' function in different areas of your forum. Select the area(s) where you would like to activate this function.
Select for which styles the toggle function can be enabled

Select which usergroups can use (and see) the toggle function in forumhome.
P.S: this addon will also take in account the user secondary usergroupid

Select which usergroups can use (and see) the toggle function in postbit.
P.S: this addon will also take in account the user secondary usergroupid
Select if the postbit must be closed by closed or opened by default (default: closed)
Select which usergroups can use (and see) the toggle function in Widgets.

Select which usergroups can use (and see) the toggle function in Wrapped Subforums area.
Explanations: if you've got many sub-forums inside a forum, they will appear above the threads. ToggleME will insert this button above them.
P.S: this addon will also take in account the user secondary usergroupid
If you check that options, these sub-forums will be automatically hidden: the user will need to click on the button to display them.

If you want to automatically close a widget when the page is loaded (providing the user didn't chose to open it during his session), just use this option. Each 'widget name' must be separated with a coma.

To find the 'widget name', you need to look inside the page code to see what is the main class for the widget. For example if my widget has the following classes: class="section visitorPanel", its main class is "visitorPanel". Tips: its css classes will always start with "section", then the second one should be the good one.

Information: Some widgets originally don't have any main class name except "section" (ie: 'Forum Statistics' Widget), which doesn't help very much to target him. To overcome this problem, ToggleMe automatically adds them a generic class name according to the widget position inside the sidebar. The generic class format is the following one: tglblock_ + page position.

So if you change the widget position and you want it to be closed by default, you will need to come back here because its class name will have changed..

Information about the Widget Framework: If you use the addon [bd] Widget Framework, ToggleME will automatically detect it. If you want to close by default a widget or don't want to activate the Toggle function for it, put its full class name using this pattern.
Example for the statistics widget: WidgetFramework_WidgetRenderer_Stats

Some widgets should not have the toggle function activated. For example, the login button and the visitor panel. Each 'widget name' must be separated with a coma.

To find the 'widget name', you need to look inside the page code to see what is the main class for the widget. For example if my widget has the following classes: class="section visitorPanel", its main class is "visitorPanel". Tips: its css classes will always start with "section", then the second one should be the good one.

Option default values for this option: loginButton,visitorPanel

templates.template:
<xen:comment>These CSS must be configured with xenForo Appearance Configuration Tool</xen:comment>

.nodeList .CategoryStripCollapsed
{
	{xen:property CategoryStripCollapsed}
}

	.nodeList .CategoryStripCollapsed .nodeTitle
	{
		{xen:property CategoryStripCollapsedTitle}
	}
	
		.nodeList .CategoryStripCollapsed .nodeTitle a
		{
			color: {xen:property CategoryStripCollapsedTitle.color};
		}

	.nodeList .CategoryStripCollapsed .nodeDescription
	{
		{xen:property CategoryStripCollapsedDescription}
	}
	
		.nodeList .CategoryStripCollapsed .nodeDescription a
		{
			color: {xen:property CategoryStripCollapsedDescription.color};
		}
.nodeList .tglNodelist_forumview.active
{
	{xen:property tglNodelist_forumview_active}
}
	.nodeList .tglNodelist_forumview span.toggleME_Collapse
	{
		{xen:property tglNodelist_forumview_active_text}
	}
.nodeList .tglNodelist_forumview.inactive
{
	{xen:property tglNodelist_forumview_inactive}
}
	.nodeList .tglNodelist_forumview span.toggleME_Expand
	{
		{xen:property tglNodelist_forumview_inactive_text}
	}

.secondaryContentCollapsed
{
	{xen:property secondaryContentCollapsed}
}

.secondaryContentCollapsed h3
{
	{xen:property secondaryContentCollapsedTitle}
}

.secondaryContentCollapsed h3 a:link, .secondaryContentCollapsed h3 a:visited
{
	text-decoration: none;
	color: {xen:property secondaryContentCollapsedTitle.color};
}
